noun.description: A chisel with a concave blade, used in carpentry, sculpture, and surgery.
An indentation or groove made by gouging.

verb.description: Make (a groove, hole, or indentation) with or as if with a gouge.
examples: the channel had been gouged out by the ebbing water
the airline ends up gouging the very passengers it is supposed to assist

origin: Late Middle English: from Old French, from late Latin gubia, gulbia, perhaps of Celtic origin; compare with Old Irish gulba beak and Welsh gylf beak, pointed instrument.
